author: Greg Michalowski
title: Forexlive Americas FX news wrap 25 Apr: GDP growth/inflation scare markets
text:
[It's the perfect day, and it's also Bank of Japan decision day](/news/its-the-perfect-day-and-its-also-bank-of-japan-decision-day-20240425/) [Broader US indices close lower for the first time after three days of gains](/news/broader-us-indices-closed-lower-for-the-first-time-after-three-days-higher-20240425/) [Alphabet EPS $1.89 versus $1.51 estimate. Revenues $80.54B versus $78.59B estimate](/news/alphabet-eps-189-versus-151-estimate-revenues-8054b-versus-7859b-estimate-20240425/) [Microsoft EPS $2.94 vs $2.82 estimate Revenues: $61.86 vs $60.82 estimate](/news/microsoft-eps-294-vs-282-estimate-revenues-6186-vs-6082-estimate-20240425/) [WSJ Timiraos: "The Dream of a Fed rate cuts is slipping away"](/centralbank/wsj-timiraos-the-dream-of-a-fed-rate-cuts-is-slipping-away-20240425/) [Crude oil settles at $83.57](/news/crude-oil-settles-at-8357-20240425/) [ECBs Panetta: We must weigh risk of monetary policy becoming too tight](/centralbank/ecbs-panetta-we-must-weigh-risk-of-monetary-policy-becoming-too-tight-20240425/) [U.S. Treasury auctions off $44 billion of the seven year notes at a high yield of 4.716%](/news/us-treasury-auctions-off-44-billion-of-the-seven-year-notes-at-a-high-yield-of-4716-20240425/) [Major European indices close lower. US stocks lower. Yields are higher.](/news/major-european-indices-close-lower-us-stocks-lower-yields-are-20240425/) [Goldman Sachs: The composition of the GDP report was not as soft as it looked](/news/goldman-sachs-the-composition-of-the-gdp-report-was-not-as-soft-as-it-looked-20240425/) [US pending home sales for March 3.4% versus 0.8% estimate](/news/us-pending-home-sales-for-march-34-versus-08-estimate-20240425/) [US Treas Secretary Yellen: GDP data shows straight a consumer investment spending](/news/us-treas-secretary-yellen-gdp-data-shows-straight-a-consumer-investment-spending-20240425/) [US yields move to new session highs. The 2 &10 year yields at highest level since November](/news/us-yields-move-to-new-at-session-highs-20240425/) [Kickstart the FX day for April 25 with a technical look at EURUSD, USDJPY and GBPUSD](/technical-analysis/kickstart-the-fx-day-for-april-25-with-a-technical-look-at-eurusd-usdjpy-and-gbpusd-20240425/) [REPORT:BOJ to reportedly consider measures to reduce its government bond purchases](/centralbank/reportboj-to-reportedly-consider-measures-to-reduce-its-government-bond-purchases-20240425/) [Fed rate hike pricing plunges after GDP data](/centralbank/fed-rate-hike-pricing-plunges-after-gdp-data-20240425/) [Canada Feb average weekly earnings 4.53% vs 3.88% prior](/news/canada-feb-average-weekly-earnings-453-vs-388-prior-20240425/) [US March wholesale inventory advanced -0.4% versus 0.4% (revised from 0.5%) last month](/news/us-march-wholesale-inventory-advanced-04-versus-04-revised-from-05-last-month-20240425/) [US March advanced goods trade balance $-91.83 billion versus $-91.1 billion estimate](/news/us-march-advanced-goods-trade-balance-9183-billion-versus-911-billion-estimate-20240425/) [US Q1 advance GDP +1.6% vs +2.4% expected](/news/us-q1-advance-gdp-16-vs-24-expected-20240425/) [US initial jobless claims 207K versus 215K estimate](/news/us-initial-jobless-claims-207k-versus-215k-estimate-20240425/) [The AUD is the strongest and the JPY is the weakest as the North American session begins](/technical-analysis/the-aud-is-the-strongest-and-the-jpy-is-the-weakest-as-the-north-american-session-begins-20240425/) [ForexLive European FX news wrap: Dollar, stocks down awaiting US GDP data](/news/forexlive-european-fx-news-wrap-dollar-stocks-down-awaiting-us-gdp-data-20240425/)
The market got a scare after Q1 advance GDP growth came in lower than expected at 1.6% versus 2.4% expected. Meanwhile core PCE data for the quarter was higher-than-expected and 3.7% versus 3.4% expected. That scared traders further ahead of the monthly core PCE data scheduled for release tomorrow at 8:30 AM ET. There were whispers that the core PCE month-to-month could rise by closer to 0.5% versus the 0.3% expected when announced tomorrow. The YoY is expected at 2.7% and would be higher given numbers higher than 0.3%.
Lower growth and higher inflation is not the recipe for markets. As a result, stocks fell, bond prices fell (yields rose), and the US dollar moved higher. Yields across the curve moved to their highest level in 2024 with the 2-year yield moving above 5% (in his trading at 4.999% currently).
In the US equity market, the Dow Industrial Average average was down over -700 points at session lows. The S&P index fell as much as 81.04 points (-1.6%), and the NASDAQ fell as much as -368.83 points (-2.31%).
However, markets steadied. US stocks started to move higher. At the end of the day:
- Dow Industrial Average average closed down -378.12 points or -0.98% at 38085.81
- S&P index fell -23.21 points or -0.46% at 5048.41
- NASDAQ index fell -100.99 points or -0.64% at 15611.76.
The small-cap Russell 2000 fell -14.308 points or -0.72% at 1981.11. At session lows, the index was down as much as -37.6 points or -1.8%.
In the Forex, the US dollar moved higher but retraced most of the declines versus the the EUR, GBP, CHF, CAD. Although the AUDUSD and the NZDUSD recovered off of session lows, they could not move up to pre-GDP release levels.
The GBP is ending the session as the strongest of the major currencies followed by the AUD. The JPY was the weakest followed by the USD.
The USDJPY moved to yet another high for the year and highest level since 1990. Tha BOJ will announce their latest rate decision in the new trading day. Technically,, it would take a break of its 100-hour moving average at 154.977 followed by a break of the 200 hour moving average at 154.717 to give the sellers some hope that a temporary high might be in place. The current price is trading at 155.64.
For the EURUSD its fall and low for the day stalled right at its 100-hour moving average before bouncing back up toward its 50% midpoint of the April trading range. That level comes in at 1.07425. A move above that level in the new trading day would be more bullish.
The GBPUSD's move lower stalled against its broken 38.2% retracement of the April trading range at 1.2455, and then snapped back higher toward its 100 bar moving average on the 4-hour chart at 1.2512. That level will be the barometer for trading in the new trading day.
Bank of Japan tonight. Core PCE data tomorrow.

author: Zineb Jazouli
title: PCNS : urgence d'une révision des stratégies alimentaires face à la crise hydrique
text:
De plus en plus enfoncé profondément dans la crise hydrique, le Maroc souffre d’une déshydratation sévère, tous les indices le confirment. Un rapport récent révèle que la disponibilité en eau par habitant au Maroc a connu une baisse drastique, passant de 2.650 mètres cubes en 1960 à seulement 620 mètres cubes ces dernières années. Cette réduction soulève des interrogations sérieuses quant à la viabilité de l’approche en matière de sécurité alimentaire adoptée par le royaume.
Selon le rapport publié par Policy Center for the New South (PCNS) sous le titre “ Sécurité alimentaire et politiques agroalimentaires dans le Nouveau Sud”, il est désormais impératif de réévaluer en profondeur la stratégie actuelle, en particulier face aux défis croissants liés à la pénurie d’eau et aux changements climatiques.
Le rapport dévoile des inquiétudes quant à la capacité du royaume à s’adapter à ces défis futurs et appelle à la formulation d’un nouveau contrat social entre le gouvernement et la population. Ce contrat devrait se concentrer sur une gestion durable des ressources en eau et alimentaires, la stabilité des prix des produits de première nécessité, et la promotion de la transition vers les énergies renouvelables.
Le rapport souligne qu’en dépit des efforts du Maroc pour atteindre l’autosuffisance alimentaire, le pays reste fortement dépendant des importations de céréales, notamment le blé. Malgré les investissements substantiels dans les projets d’irrigation et le Plan Maroc Vert, les cultures pluviales continuent de dominer plus de la moitié des terres agricoles, ce qui représente un défi majeur pour assurer une sécurité alimentaire durable.
Il est également indiqué que l’approche axée sur l’autosuffisance alimentaire, adoptée par le royaume depuis des décennies, est désormais insoutenable en raison de la rareté croissante de l’eau. Le rapport exhorte donc à une révision urgente de cette approche et à l’adoption de nouvelles stratégies garantissant la sécurité alimentaire tout en préservant les ressources en eau.
Par ailleurs, le rapport met en lumière les défis accrus auxquels le royaume fait face à cause des changements climatiques, entraînant des sécheresses récurrentes et une diminution des précipitations, ce qui accroît la pression sur les ressources en eau.
Il avertit que le maintien de l’approche actuelle sans modifications substantielles exposera le pays à des risques accrus, particulièrement dans un contexte mondial marqué par une crise de l’eau exacerbée par les changements climatiques.

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Thick Fog Disrupts Flights and Chills North India | Headlines
text:
Thick Fog Disrupts Flights and Chills North India
Delhi airport warns travelers of potential flight disruptions due to dense fog, affecting non-CAT III compliant flights. Temperature dips to 9.6°C in Delhi, with AQI in 'very poor' range. Shelter provided for homeless amidst cold wave hitting northern states including Uttar Pradesh and Jammu & Kashmir.
[Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Updated: 03-01-2025 09:47 IST | Created: 03-01-2025 09:47 IST
- Country:
- India
Facing dense fog conditions, Delhi airport authorities announced potential flight disruptions on Friday. Non-CAT III compliant flights may be affected, they noted in a social media post. Operations, however, continue for flights meeting the stringent visual landing standards.
Authorities have advised passengers to stay updated with their respective airlines for flight information while extending regret over any travel inconveniences. The city shivered as morning temperatures touched 9.6 degrees Celsius, paired with a concerning AQI of 348, placing it in the 'very poor' category according to the Indian Meteorological Department.
Night shelters, including 235 pagoda tents, were operational for the homeless across Delhi. Bonfire gatherings were a common sight as citizens braced the cold. While Delhi battled its own cold wave, the drop in temperatures was more severe in other northern states. Lucknow in Uttar Pradesh recorded 8 degrees Celsius, while Srinagar in Jammu and Kashmir noted a chilling -1.3 degrees Celsius.
(With inputs from agencies.)

author: RFI
title: El campeón olímpico Djokovic renuncia a participar en el Masters 1000 de Cincinnati
text:
El campeón olímpico Djokovic renuncia a participar en el Masters 1000 de Cincinnati
Washington (AFP) – El campeón olímpico de individuales de París-2024, el serbio Novak Djokovic, declinó participar en el Masters 1000 de de Cincinnati de la próxima semana, última gran cita de preparación para el Abierto de Estados Unidos, anunciaron este jueves los organizadores.
Primera modificación:
Djokovic, número dos del mundo y ganador de 24 torneos de Grand Slam, se proclamó campeón el año pasado en Cincinnati, la tercera vez que gana ese torneo.
'Nole' no ha ganado un título de Grand Slam desde que conquistó el Abierto de Estados Unidos en 2023 y este año ha perdido en las semifinales del Abierto de Australia, en los cuartos de final del Abierto de Francia y en la final de Wimbledon.
El pasado domingo en París venció al español Carlos Alcaraz -con quien perdió en Wimbledon- en la final olímpica.
"Entendemos que su triunfo en los Juegos Olímpicos le haya hecho cambiar de opinión rápidamente para venir a Cincinnati", declaró Bob Moran, director del Abierto de Cincinnati.
"Su carrera hacia el título aquí el año pasado fue memorable. Estamos ansiosos por volver a verle pronto en la pista", agregó.
© 2024 AFP

author: Mehul Srivastava
title: Hamas accepts proposal to swap hostages for prisoners – The Irish Times
text: Hamas has said it has broadly accepted a proposal to free dozens of Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners and a temporary ceasefire in its seven-month war with Israel in Gaza. However, Israel has said that the terms negotiated are not acceptable to it and that it will continue with its plans for a military operation in Rafah. According to a statement on Hamas’s Telegram channel on Monday, Ismail Haniyeh, the Palestinian militant group’s Doha-based political leader, told the Qatari premier and Egypt’s intelligence chief of “the Hamas movement’s approval of their proposal regarding the ceasefire”. Hamas did not announce the details of the deal it agreed to, but Israeli prime minister Binyamin Netanyahu said they were “far from meeting Israeli demands”. He confirmed that the military operation in Rafah would continue and there were report that air strikes continued on Monday night. However, Mr Netanyahu said Israel would send a delegation to negotiate the ceasefire deal further. [ [Israel announces strikes in Rafah despite Hamas ceasefire moves](https://www.irishtimes.com/world/middle-east/2024/05/06/israel-announces-strikes-in-rafah-despite-hamas-ceasefire-moves/) ] A diplomat briefed on the talks said the draft proposal Hamas accepted was broadly similar to the one put forward by mediators about two weeks ago. The plan – brokered by Qatar, Egypt and the United States – includes calls for an initial six-week pause in the war during which Hamas would release 33 hostages, including women, children, older and wounded people. This would be followed by what mediators hope would be an extended ceasefire – described as “restoring a sustainable calm” – during which the remaining hostages would be freed. Israeli officials say Hamas is holding 132 hostages, and believe 37 of them to be dead. “Hamas has called Netanyahu’s bluff, and put the ball in his court,” the diplomat said. Khalil al-Hayya, a Hamas leader in Gaza, told Al Jazeera that the proposal it had accepted included an assurance that in “its second phase, [there will be a] direct announcement of a permanent cessation of military and hostile operations”. “We made concessions so the door can be opened to stop this crazy war and for there to be a real prisoner exchange,” he said in televised remarks. There was no exact date attached to the proposal for an Israeli approval, he added. Hamas’s announcement came hours after Israel ordered the evacuation of eastern Rafah, a border town at Gaza’s southern tip that has become the last refuge for more than a million Palestinians who have fled the war between Israel and Hamas. Mr Netanyahu’s office said over the weekend that the Israeli military would “enter Rafah and destroy the remaining Hamas battalions there – whether or not there will be a temporary pause for the release of our hostages”. His far-right coalition ally, national security minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, said on X that Israel should reject Hamas’s latest move. “Hamas’s tricks and games have only one answer: an immediate order to occupy Rafah, increasing military pressure, and continuing the complete pounding of Hamas, until its full defeat,” he added. Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdogan said: “We are pleased that Hamas has agreed to the ceasefire after our calls. Now Israel should take the same step.” Egypt, Qatar and the US have been mediating between Israel and Hamas for a second round of hostage-for-prisoner swaps, following one last November that involved more than 100 captives in Gaza freed in exchange for hundreds of Palestinian prisoners. The talks had been stalled for months as Hamas demanded that any agreement end with a permanent ceasefire and the full withdrawal of Israeli troops from Gaza. Mr Netanyahu, under pressure from far-right members of his ruling coalition, has repeatedly rejected Hamas’s demands. Mediators were hopeful of a breakthrough a week ago after Israel appeared to soften its stance on some key conditions for a deal. But any optimism over a possible agreement faded after Mr Netanyahu said the offensive on Rafah would still go ahead, with or without a hostage deal, and Hamas continued to insist on a permanent ceasefire. The families of Israeli hostages, who were protesting on a central Tel Aviv highway in support of a deal, told reporters that they were cautiously optimistic of a genuine breakthrough. Hamas’s move comes after a flurry of diplomacy, during which Central Intelligence Agency director Bill Burns travelled to Cairo and then Qatar, where he has been holding talks with Qatari prime minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman al-Thani. Qatar hosts Hamas’s political office. Mr Burns was expected to travel to Israel this week as the US stepped up the pressure for a hostage deal and to convince Israel not to move ahead with the offensive on Rafah. – Copyright The Financial Times Limited 2024 - Sign up for [push alerts](https://www.irishtimes.com/media/2023/11/07/stay-informed-with-push-alerts-from-the-irish-times-delivered-straight-to-your-phone/)and have the best news, analysis and comment delivered directly to your phone - Find [The Irish Times on WhatsApp](https://www.irishtimes.com/media/2023/10/27/find-the-irish-times-on-whatsapp-and-stay-up-to-date/)and stay up to date - Listen to our [Inside Politics podcast](https://www.irishtimes.com/podcasts/inside-politics/)for the best political chat and analysis

author: world today news
title: Afghanistan: The United Nations as soon as once more denounces Taliban crimes in opposition to ladies
text:
ROMA – On June 18, Richard Bennett, United Nations particular rapporteur on human rights in Afghanistan, will current the most recent report back to the Human Rights Council through which he strongly requires the Taliban to be held liable for the crimes dedicated in opposition to ladies within the Asian nation. The file examines the “institutionalized system of discrimination, segregation, based mostly on the shortage of respect for human dignity and the exclusion of girls” promoted by the Taliban authorities.
The human rights disaster . Girls’s rights in Afghanistan is among the most severe crises on this planet and is continually worsening, the United Nations denounces. The Taliban proceed to problem bans that nearly impede ladies’s lives and intensify checks on their appropriate utility. In March, de facto authorities dominated that girls who commit so-called ethical crimes, similar to intercourse outdoors of marriage and abandoning the marital dwelling – which ladies are sometimes pushed to do to keep away from home violence – ought to be stoned to demise to demise. Women are prohibited from schooling past the sixth grade, many types of work, free motion, the correct to protest and the potential of main a life with a public dimension. They typically describe themselves as prisoners in their very own properties and it’s no shock that suicide charges are on the rise. Bennett defines the Taliban’s system of discrimination in opposition to ladies as a criminal offense in opposition to humanity and a widespread and systematic assault in opposition to your entire civilian inhabitants of the nation.
The final state of affairs of the nation . The Afghan disaster “shouldn’t be a hopeless disaster”, Edem Wosornu, of the United Nations Humanitarian Affairs Workplace, informed journalists in New York ( OCHA ) following a go to to the nation. General, 23 million individuals in Afghanistan stay due to humanitarian help: a five-fold improve in comparison with 2019. Over 15 million residents, nonetheless, discover themselves going through the danger of looming starvation. Current floods in central and northern areas have added additional distress. On this context, the restrictions imposed by the Taliban authorities on Afghan humanitarian employees have sophisticated assist and aid operations all through the nation.
The displaced . On Sunday 2 June the Afghan authorities started demolishing casual settlements for internally displaced individuals in Kabul, leaving greater than 800 susceptible households, round six thousand individuals, homeless, writes the Norwegian Refugee Council . Afghanistan has been within the grip of humanitarian and socio-economic crises for the reason that Taliban took energy in August 2021. As of the tip of 2023, 4.2 million individuals have been internally displaced. The sudden return of round 600,000 susceptible Afghans from Pakistan since final September has dramatically elevated the variety of displaced individuals within the nation as assets develop into more and more restricted.
#Afghanistan #United #Nations #denounces #Taliban #crimes #ladies
– 2024-06-13 18:54:51
